text: MEETCS Code of Conduct Policy Purpose: This policy defines the expected standards of behavior for all employees and stakeholders at MEETCS. It aims to promote a professional, respectful, ethical, and inclusive workplace where all individuals can thrive and contribute positively. 1. Respect & Inclusion Treat everyone—colleagues, clients, and stakeholders—with respect, dignity, and courtesy. Embrace diversity and create an inclusive work environment that values all perspectives. Avoid any form of discrimination, harassment, or offensive behavior based on race, ethnicity, gender, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic. 2. Integrity & Honesty Conduct all business interactions with integrity, honesty, and transparency. Avoid unethical practices such as fraud or misrepresentation. Promptly report unethical behavior or code violations to your Manager, HR, or a designated authority. 3. Confidentiality Maintain the confidentiality of all sensitive and proprietary information related to MEETCS, its clients, and employees. Do not share confidential data with unauthorized individuals or use it for personal benefit. 4. Professionalism Exhibit professionalism in communication, conduct, and performance. Follow dress code and behavior guidelines appropriate to the workplace. 5. Conflict of Interest Avoid situations that may compromise your ability to make impartial decisions. Disclose any actual or potential conflicts of interest to your Manager or HR immediately. 6. Workplace Safety Prioritize personal and collective safety at all times. Adhere to safety protocols and report any hazards or incidents without delay. 7. Legal & Regulatory Compliance Abide by all relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards. Consult HR or the legal team if you're uncertain about compliance requirements. 8. Social Media & Online Conduct Use social media responsibly and ensure your online activity aligns with MEETCS’s values. Do not share confidential information or engage in harmful, disrespectful, or inappropriate conduct online. 9. Reporting Violations Report any misconduct or violations of this policy to your Manager,

HR, or appropriate authority. MEETCS prohibits retaliation against individuals who report concerns in good faith. 10. Consequences of Misconduct Breaches of this Code of Conduct may result in disciplinary action, including termination of employment, depending on the severity of the violation.

MEETCS Employee Separation & Probation Policy 📅 Effective Date: May 1, 2022 🔹 1. Voluntary Separation (Resignation) 1.1 Notice of Resignation Employees must formally notify the company before resigning. Notice period: Probation period: 15 days Confirmed employees: 60 days Full notice period must be served to ensure a proper transition of responsibilities. 1.2 Full and Final Settlement Salary is withheld from the date of resignation for final settlement. Full and final settlement is processed within 45 days after the last working day. Settlement is not part of the regular payroll cycle. 1.3 Relieving Letter and Documents The relieving letter is provided on the last working day. Any additional documents must be requested via email and will be issued with the final settlement. 1.4 Failure to Serve Notice If the notice period is not served fully, the employee must pay liquidated damages equal to the gross salary for the shortfall. Note: Unused Privilege Leaves cannot be used to offset the notice period. 🔹 2. Involuntary Separation (Termination) 2.1 Termination Without Cause MEETCS may terminate employment without cause by: Serving notice, or Paying gross salary equivalent to the shortfall in notice period Notice period: Probation period: 15 days Confirmed employees: 60 days 2.2 Termination With Cause MEETCS may terminate employment without notice or compensation for cause, including: Violation of employment agreement Breach of company code of conduct or policies Discrepancies found in background verification Poor performance during training or duty Damage to company’s reputation or assets Unauthorized absences Insubordination or misconduct Any other unacceptable behavior 🔹 3. Retirement Automatic retirement occurs at the end of the month in which the employee turns 60 years old. MEETCS Employee Probation Policy 🔹 1. Scope & Eligibility Applicable to all full-time employees and trainees 🔹 2. Probation Period Specified in the appointment letter For trainees:
sourceFile: MEETCS Employee Sepration  Probation Policy May 22.txt

text: 3 months after completing the training period 🔹 3. Confirmation Process At the end of probation, employees are evaluated monthly Based on performance, a confirmation letter is issued if expectations are met Confirmation decision lies with the Reporting Officer/Functional Head 🔹 4. Extension of Probation Probation may be extended if: Evaluation time is insufficient Performance does not meet expectations

text: MEETCS IT Policy 📍 Location: Vashi, Navi Mumbai 📅 Effective Date: 16 June 2021 🔹 Purpose & Objective To ensure the responsible, secure, and legal use of MEETCS’s IT infrastructure. Employees are encouraged to use IT resources productively for official work, while ensuring their actions do not pose risks to the company or others. 🔹 Scope Applies to all MEETCS-provided technology: laptops, desktops, mobile devices, internet, email, and internal networks. Covers all modes of electronic communication, including social media. Violations may result in restricted access or disciplinary action, including termination. 🔹 General Policy Guidelines Employees must use all MEETCS technology: Responsibly and ethically Primarily for job-related tasks In accordance with applicable laws and company policies Unacceptable uses include: Harassment or defamation Transmission of pornographic, discriminatory, or offensive content Illegal activities like software piracy or unauthorized access Spamming or sending large files that affect network performance 🔹 Confidentiality & Monitoring All IT systems and data are property of MEETCS. Usage may be monitored (email, internet, files, etc.). Communications may be subject to legal discovery. Employees must not: Hide their identity Send anonymous or deceptive communications Use unauthorized systems or third-party software 🔹 Email Communication Best Practices Be courteous and professional in all written communication. Do not send defamatory or inflammatory content. Treat email as official documentation (can be produced in court). Do not share login credentials. Change passwords periodically and keep them secure. 🔹 Software & File Use Downloading software/services requires prior approval. All files must be scanned with antivirus tools before use. Counterfeit or pirated software is strictly prohibited and may expose data to malwar 🔹 Copyright & Intellectual Property Do not transmit third-party copyrighted content without permission. Violations may lead to disciplinary or legal consequences. 🔹 Social Media Conduct Be mindful of what you post; your content is often

public and permanent. Do not share confidential company information or make derogatory comments. Both personal and professional posts that affect MEETCS's reputation may lead to disciplinary action. Always uphold MEETCS’s values in online interactions.

MEETCS Learning & Development Policy 🔹 Objective To foster a continuous learning culture that enhances employee skills, knowledge, and competencies—supporting both individual growth and MEETCS’s business objectives. 🔹 Scope This policy applies to: All permanent full-time and part-time employees of MEETCS Temporary/contract staff may participate with managerial approval Excludes third-party contractors or consultants 🔹 Roles & Responsibilities Employees: Seek growth opportunities and take ownership of development Managers: Identify learning needs, support team development HR: Enable and oversee learning programs and resources 🔹 Training Delivery Methods Training may be delivered via: Formal sessions (individual or group) Internal/external expert sessions On-the-Job Training (OJT) E-learning platforms Conferences/Seminars Subscription & Educational Materials: Employees can request access to learning resources (news, journals, etc.) Requires written approval from both manager and HR Costs must be within training budget Invoices and cost details to be submitted to HR post-subscription 🔹 Training Categories Technical Skills: Job/function-specific expertise Managerial Skills: Leadership and team management abilities Soft Skills: Interpersonal and communication enhancement Professional Certification: Industry-recognized certifications 🔹 Individual Training Programs Eligibility: Minimum 6 months of employment Company determines eligibility and program relevance Emergencies must be reported to HR and managers Attendance is mandatory; proof may be required Company-sponsored mandatory training is fully funded 🔹 Corporate Training Occasional sessions with external experts Entire cost is covered by MEETCS Participation and attendance may be tracked 🔹 Procedure to Apply for External Training Identify Need: Employee/team lead identifies skill gap Submit Proposal: Forward to HR with training details HR Review: Evaluates based on relevance, cost, and budget Approval/Rejection: Rejections are explained in writing Payment & Reimbursement: Employee initially pays Reimbursement after proof of completion Failing an exam means no reimbursement; retake is employee's responsibility Note: Employees must serve 2 years post-certification if reimbursed. Leaving before 2 years requires repayment of training and certification
cost. 🔹 Training Evaluation Conducted via forms, surveys, or discussions Evaluation focuses on: Knowledge/skills gained Application of learning in work Fulfillment of training objectives

🔹 1. Eligibility Criteria Employees under probation are not eligible for salary advances or loans. Employees with a minimum of 6 months of service are eligible. No new loan will be sanctioned until previous loans are fully repaid. 🔹 2. Advance Against Current Month’s Salary Employees may request up to 50% of their earned salary (till date). Allowed only between the 10th to 25th of each calendar month. 🔹 3. Loan Limits Based on Experience Loan Limits Based on Length of Service: Applicable to Grades: Product Developers, Senior Developers, Testers, Module Leads, Project Leads, Team Leads, Junior Executives Loan Eligibility Based on Experience: < 1 year of service: Max loan = 1.5× monthly salary Repayment period = 6 months 1–2 years of service: Max loan = 2× monthly salary Repayment period = 12 months 2+ years of service: Max loan = 3× monthly salary Repayment period = 15 months 🔹 4. Sanctioning Authority Advances and loans must be approved by the respective Management Representative. 🔹 5. Interest Interest is charged at 11% per annum on all loans. 🔹 6. Loan Security A blank cheque and an undertaking must be submitted as security. In case of default, the company may encash the cheque to recover dues. 🔹 7. Documentation The company may require: A formal loan application A written declaration allowing recovery of dues (including from gratuity at exit) 🔹 8. Application Procedure Submit completed application form to Manager/HR/Management Representative. Ensure the reason for the loan is valid and all fields are filled properly. The Head of Department’s recommendation is mandatory. Final approval comes from Sr. VP/CEO/MD after HR review. 🔹 9. Repayment Installments The loan must be repaid within the same financial year or within 12 months of disbursal (whichever is earlier). 🔹 10. Policy Flexibility Any deviation from this

policy requires explicit management approval. 🔹 11. Right to Modify MEETCS reserves the right to alter, discontinue, or withdraw this policy at any time, without creating legal obligations for the employee.

MEETCS’s POSH Policy The purpose of the POSH Policy is to provide a safe working environment to the employees (both men and women) in the Company including safety from the persons coming in contact with the employees at the Company. Under the policy MEETCS has constituted an Internal Complaints Committee in accordance with the Sexual Harassment Laws to redress any complaint of sexual harassment filed by an Aggrieved Employees. MEETCS will ensure the implementation of this Policy in its letter and spirit through prevention of acts of sexual harassment, proper reporting and redressal of the complaints and the follow-up procedures and also to promote an environment this would raise awareness amongst the Employees about sexual harassment in its various forms and to sensitise the Employees with the various provisions as given under the Sexual Harassment Laws. Defining Sexual Harassment The aim of this Policy is to protect the employees (both men and women) from the acts of sexual harassment. Sexual Harassment includes any one or more of the following unwelcome acts or behaviour (whether directly or by implication) towards any person namely: (i) physical contact and advances; or (ii) a demand or request for sexual favours; or (iii) making sexually coloured remarks; or (iv) showing pornography; or (v) any other unwelcome physical, verbal or non-verbal conduct of sexual nature. The following circumstances, among other circumstances, if it occurs or is present in relation to or connected with any of the above act or behaviour of sexual harassment will also amount to Sexual Harassment: (i) implied or explicit promise of preferential treatment in the employment; or (ii) implied or explicit threat of detrimental treatment in the employment; or (iii) implied or explicit threat about the present or future employment status; or (iv) interference with the work or creating an intimidating

or offensive or hostile work environment; or (v) humiliating treatment likely to affect health or safety. The Company has constituted an Internal Complaints Committee in accordance with Section 4 of the Act. The Presiding Officer of the Committee and other members comprising the Committee who will be nominated by the Company shall hold office in accordance with the Sexual Harassment Laws and shall be notified by the Company from time to time. Complaint An Aggrieved Employee may make, in writing, a complaint of Sexual Harassment to the Committee, within a period of three months from the date of incident and in case of a series of incidents, within a period of three months from the date of the last incident: Provided that where such complaint cannot be made in writing, the Presiding Officer or any Member of the Committee, as the case may be, shall render all reasonable assistance to the Aggrieved Woman for making the complaint in writing: Provided further that the Committee may, for the reasons to be recorded in writing extend the time limit not exceeding three months, if it is satisfied that the circumstances were such which prevented the Aggrieved Woman from filing a complaint within the above said period of three months. In case the Aggrieved Employee is unable to make complaint then a complaint can also be filed in accordance with the Sexual Harassment Laws by their legal heirs, relatives, friends, co-worker, special educator, qualified psychologist, guardian or any person who has knowledge of the incident as the case may be. On the receipt of the Complaint, the Committee shall sit within a period of 48 working hours and brief the Aggrieved employee about the provisions of the Act and remove deficiencies, if any in the Complaint which is filed. Settlement The Committee may,

before initiating an inquiry on the Complaint and at the request of the Aggrieved employee take steps to settle the matter between him/her and the Respondent through conciliation. However, no monetary settlement shall be made a basis of this conciliation between the Aggrieved Employee and the Respondent. The settlement so arrived at between the parties shall be recorded in writing by the Committee and copy of which shall be furnished to the authorised representative of the Company and also to the parties. Where a settlement is arrived at, as provided above, no further inquiry shall be conducted by the Committee unless the Respondent breaches any condition of the settlement. In case no settlement is arrived at between the parties and the Respondent is an Employee of the Company, the Committee shall, proceed to make inquiry into the complaint in the manner as provided under the Service Rules and Sexual Harassment Laws, as may be applicable. Further if the Aggrieved Employee informs the Committee that any term or condition of the settlement (as provided above) arrived at between the parties has not been complied with by the Respondent; the Committee shall proceed to make an inquiry into the complaint. Provided further that where both the parties are Employees, the parties shall, during the course of inquiry, be given an opportunity of being heard and a copy of the interim findings of the Committee shall be made available to both the parties enabling them to make representations against the findings before the Committee. Internal Complaints Committee Members Head - Dr. Ela Goyal (Co-Founder and CTO) Member - Dr. Mahendra Gupta (Co-Founder and CEO) Member – Mr. Bhushan Nimutkar (HR and Office Co-ordinator)
